description: Number of 4's when k is written in base b for all b and k satisfying 2<=b<=n+1, 1<=k<=n.
mathematica: f[n_] := Count[ Flatten@ Table[ IntegerDigits[k, b], {k, n}, {b, 2, n + 1}], 4] - (n - 4); f[1] = f[2] = f[3] = 0; Array[f, 59] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 14 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
